00050 
00051 // Top-level class for all tesseract global instance data.
00052 // This class either holds or points to all data used by an instance
00053 // of Tesseract, including the memory allocator. When this is
00054 // complete, Tesseract will be thread-safe. UNTIL THEN, IT IS NOT!
00055 //
00056 // NOTE to developers: Do not create cyclic dependencies through this class!
00057 // The directory dependency tree must remain a tree! The keep this clean,
00058 // lower-level code (eg in ccutil, the bottom level) must never need to
00059 // know about the content of a higher-level directory.
00060 // The following scheme will grant the easiest access to lower-level
00061 // global members without creating a cyclic dependency:
00062 //
00063 // Class Hierarchy (^ = inheritance):
00064 //
00065 //             CCUtil (ccutil/ccutil.h)
00066 //                         ^      Members include: UNICHARSET
00067 //            CUtil (cutil/cutil_class.h)
00068 //                         ^       Members include: TBLOB*, TEXTBLOCK*
00069 //           CCStruct (ccstruct/ccstruct.h)
00070 //                         ^       Members include: Image
00071 //           Classify (classify/classify.h)
00072 //                         ^       Members include: Dict
00073 //             WordRec (wordrec/wordrec.h)
00074 //                         ^       Members include: WERD*, DENORM*
00075 //        Tesseract (ccmain/tesseractclass.h)
00076 //                                 Members include: Pix*, CubeRecoContext*,
00077 //                                 TesseractCubeCombiner*
00078 //
00079 // Other important classes:
00080 //
00081 //  TessBaseAPI (api/baseapi.h)
00082 //                                 Members include: BLOCK_LIST*, PAGE_RES*,
00083 //                                 Tesseract*, ImageThresholder*
00084 //  Dict (dict/dict.h)
00085 //                                 Members include: Image* (private)
00086 //
00087 // NOTE: that each level contains members that correspond to global
00088 // data that is defined (and used) at that level, not necessarily where
00089 // the type is defined so for instance:
00090 // BOOL_VAR_H(textord_show_blobs, false, "Display unsorted blobs");
00091 // goes inside the Textord class, not the cc_util class.
00092 
00093 namespace tesseract {
00094

00107 // A collection of various variables for statistics and debugging.
00108 struct TesseractStats {
00109   TesseractStats()
00110     : adaption_word_number(0),
00111       doc_blob_quality(0),
00112       doc_outline_errs(0),
00113       doc_char_quality(0),
00114       good_char_count(0),
00115       doc_good_char_quality(0),
00116       word_count(0),
00117       dict_words(0),
00118       tilde_crunch_written(false),
00119       last_char_was_newline(true),
00120       last_char_was_tilde(false),
00121       write_results_empty_block(true) {}
00122 
00123   inT32 adaption_word_number;
00124   inT16 doc_blob_quality;
00125   inT16 doc_outline_errs;
00126   inT16 doc_char_quality;
00127   inT16 good_char_count;
00128   inT16 doc_good_char_quality;
00129   inT32 word_count;  // count of word in the document
00130   inT32 dict_words;  // number of dicitionary words in the document
00131   STRING dump_words_str;  // accumulator used by dump_words()
00132   // Flags used by write_results()
00133   bool tilde_crunch_written;
00134   bool last_char_was_newline;
00135   bool last_char_was_tilde;
00136   bool write_results_empty_block;
00137 };

00139 class Tesseract : public Wordrec {
00140  public:
00141   Tesseract();
00142   ~Tesseract();
00143 
00144   // Clear as much used memory as possible without resetting the adaptive
00145   // classifier or losing any other classifier data.
00146   void Clear();
00147   // Clear all memory of adaption for this and all subclassifiers.
00148   void ResetAdaptiveClassifier();
00149   // Clear the document dictionary for this and all subclassifiers.
00150   void ResetDocumentDictionary();
00151 
00152   // Set the equation detector.
00153   void SetEquationDetect(EquationDetect* detector);
00154 
00155   // Simple accessors.
00156   const FCOORD& reskew() const {
00157     return reskew_;
00158   }
00159   // Destroy any existing pix and return a pointer to the pointer.
00160   Pix** mutable_pix_binary() {
00161     Clear();
00162     return &pix_binary_;
00163   }
00164   Pix* pix_binary() const {
00165     return pix_binary_;
00166   }
00167   Pix* pix_grey() const {
00168     return pix_grey_;
00169   }
00170   void set_pix_grey(Pix* grey_pix) {
00171     pixDestroy(&pix_grey_);
00172     pix_grey_ = grey_pix;
00173   }
00174   // Returns a pointer to a Pix representing the best available image of the
00175   // page. The image will be 8-bit grey if the input was grey or color. Note
00176   // that in grey 0 is black and 255 is white. If the input was binary, then
00177   // the returned Pix will be binary. Note that here black is 1 and white is 0.
00178   // To tell the difference pixGetDepth() will return 8 or 1.
00179   // In either case, the return value is a borrowed Pix, and should not be
00180   // deleted or pixDestroyed.
00181   Pix* BestPix() const {
00182     return pix_grey_ != NULL ? pix_grey_ : pix_binary_;
00183   }
00184   int source_resolution() const {
00185     return source_resolution_;
00186   }
00187   void set_source_resolution(int ppi) {
00188     source_resolution_ = ppi;
00189   }
00190   int ImageWidth() const {
00191     return pixGetWidth(pix_binary_);
00192   }
00193   int ImageHeight() const {
00194     return pixGetHeight(pix_binary_);
00195   }
00196   Pix* scaled_color() const {
00197     return scaled_color_;
00198   }
00199   int scaled_factor() const {
00200     return scaled_factor_;
00201   }
00202   void SetScaledColor(int factor, Pix* color) {
00203     scaled_factor_ = factor;
00204     scaled_color_ = color;
00205   }
00206   const Textord& textord() const {
00207     return textord_;
00208   }
00209   Textord* mutable_textord() {
00210     return &textord_;
00211   }
00212 
00213   bool right_to_left() const {
00214     return right_to_left_;
00215   }
00216   int num_sub_langs() const {
00217     return sub_langs_.size();
00218   }
00219   Tesseract* get_sub_lang(int index) const {
00220     return sub_langs_[index];
00221   }

00339   // Initialize for potentially a set of languages defined by the language
00340   // string and recursively any additional languages required by any language
00341   // traineddata file (via tessedit_load_sublangs in its config) that is loaded.
00342   // See init_tesseract_internal for args.
00343   int init_tesseract(const char *arg0,
00344                      const char *textbase,
00345                      const char *language,
00346                      OcrEngineMode oem,
00347                      char **configs,
00348                      int configs_size,
00349                      const GenericVector<STRING> *vars_vec,
00350                      const GenericVector<STRING> *vars_values,
00351                      bool set_only_init_params);
00352   int init_tesseract(const char *datapath,
00353                      const char *language,
00354                      OcrEngineMode oem) {
00355     return init_tesseract(datapath, NULL, language, oem,
00356                           NULL, 0, NULL, NULL, false);
00357   }
00358   // Common initialization for a single language.
00359   // arg0 is the datapath for the tessdata directory, which could be the
00360   // path of the tessdata directory with no trailing /, or (if tessdata
00361   // lives in the same directory as the executable, the path of the executable,
00362   // hence the name arg0.
00363   // textbase is an optional output file basename (used only for training)
00364   // language is the language code to load.
00365   // oem controls which engine(s) will operate on the image
00366   // configs (argv) is an array of config filenames to load variables from.
00367   // May be NULL.
00368   // configs_size (argc) is the number of elements in configs.
00369   // vars_vec is an optional vector of variables to set.
00370   // vars_values is an optional corresponding vector of values for the variables
00371   // in vars_vec.
00372   // If set_only_init_params is true, then only the initialization variables
00373   // will be set.
00374   int init_tesseract_internal(const char *arg0,
00375                               const char *textbase,
00376                               const char *language,
00377                               OcrEngineMode oem,
00378                               char **configs,
00379                               int configs_size,
00380                               const GenericVector<STRING> *vars_vec,
00381                               const GenericVector<STRING> *vars_values,
00382                               bool set_only_init_params);

00518   inT16 count_outline_errs(char c, inT16 outline_count);
00519   inT16 word_outline_errs(WERD_RES *word);
00520   BOOL8 terrible_word_crunch(WERD_RES *word, GARBAGE_LEVEL garbage_level);
00521   CRUNCH_MODE word_deletable(WERD_RES *word, inT16 &delete_mode);
00522   inT16 failure_count(WERD_RES *word);
00523   BOOL8 noise_outlines(TWERD *word);
00525   void
00526   process_selected_words (
00527       PAGE_RES* page_res, // blocks to check
00528       //function to call
00529       TBOX & selection_box,
00530       BOOL8 (tesseract::Tesseract::*word_processor) (BLOCK* block,
00531                                                      ROW* row,
00532                                                      WERD_RES* word_res));
00534   void tess_add_doc_word(                          //test acceptability
00535                          WERD_CHOICE *word_choice  //after context
00536                         );
00537   void tess_segment_pass1(WERD_RES *word,
00538                           BLOB_CHOICE_LIST_CLIST *blob_choices);
00539   void tess_segment_pass2(WERD_RES *word,
00540                           BLOB_CHOICE_LIST_CLIST *blob_choices);
00541   BOOL8 tess_acceptable_word(                           //test acceptability
00542                              WERD_CHOICE *word_choice,  //after context
00543                              WERD_CHOICE *raw_choice    //before context
00544                             );
00546   // Applies the box file based on the image name fname, and resegments
00547   // the words in the block_list (page), with:
00548   // blob-mode: one blob per line in the box file, words as input.
00549   // word/line-mode: one blob per space-delimited unit after the #, and one word
00550   // per line in the box file. (See comment above for box file format.)
00551   // If find_segmentation is true, (word/line mode) then the classifier is used
00552   // to re-segment words/lines to match the space-delimited truth string for
00553   // each box. In this case, the input box may be for a word or even a whole
00554   // text line, and the output words will contain multiple blobs corresponding
00555   // to the space-delimited input string.
00556   // With find_segmentation false, no classifier is needed, but the chopper
00557   // can still be used to correctly segment touching characters with the help
00558   // of the input boxes.
00559   // In the returned PAGE_RES, the WERD_RES are setup as they would be returned
00560   // from normal classification, ie. with a word, chopped_word, rebuild_word,
00561   // seam_array, denorm, box_word, and best_state, but NO best_choice or
00562   // raw_choice, as they would require a UNICHARSET, which we aim to avoid.
00563   // Instead, the correct_text member of WERD_RES is set, and this may be later
00564   // converted to a best_choice using CorrectClassifyWords. CorrectClassifyWords
00565   // is not required before calling ApplyBoxTraining.
00566   PAGE_RES* ApplyBoxes(const STRING& fname, bool find_segmentation,
00567                        BLOCK_LIST *block_list);
00568 
00569   // Builds a PAGE_RES from the block_list in the way required for ApplyBoxes:
00570   // All fuzzy spaces are removed, and all the words are maximally chopped.
00571   PAGE_RES* SetupApplyBoxes(const GenericVector<TBOX>& boxes,
00572                             BLOCK_LIST *block_list);
00573   // Tests the chopper by exhaustively running chop_one_blob.
00574   // The word_res will contain filled chopped_word, seam_array, denorm,
00575   // box_word and best_state for the maximally chopped word.
00576   void MaximallyChopWord(const GenericVector<TBOX>& boxes,
00577                          BLOCK* block, ROW* row, WERD_RES* word_res);
00578   // Gather consecutive blobs that match the given box into the best_state
00579   // and corresponding correct_text.
00580   // Fights over which box owns which blobs are settled by pre-chopping and
00581   // applying the blobs to box or next_box with the least non-overlap.
00582   // Returns false if the box was in error, which can only be caused by
00583   // failing to find an appropriate blob for a box.
00584   // This means that occasionally, blobs may be incorrectly segmented if the
00585   // chopper fails to find a suitable chop point.
00586   bool ResegmentCharBox(PAGE_RES* page_res, const TBOX *prev_box,
00587                         const TBOX& box, const TBOX& next_box,
00588                         const char* correct_text);
00589   // Consume all source blobs that strongly overlap the given box,
00590   // putting them into a new word, with the correct_text label.
00591   // Fights over which box owns which blobs are settled by
00592   // applying the blobs to box or next_box with the least non-overlap.
00593   // Returns false if the box was in error, which can only be caused by
00594   // failing to find an overlapping blob for a box.
00595   bool ResegmentWordBox(BLOCK_LIST *block_list,
00596                         const TBOX& box, const TBOX& next_box,
00597                         const char* correct_text);
00598   // Resegments the words by running the classifier in an attempt to find the
00599   // correct segmentation that produces the required string.
00600   void ReSegmentByClassification(PAGE_RES* page_res);
00601   // Converts the space-delimited string of utf8 text to a vector of UNICHAR_ID.
00602   // Returns false if an invalid UNICHAR_ID is encountered.
00603   bool ConvertStringToUnichars(const char* utf8,
00604                                GenericVector<UNICHAR_ID>* class_ids);
00605   // Resegments the word to achieve the target_text from the classifier.
00606   // Returns false if the re-segmentation fails.
00607   // Uses brute-force combination of upto kMaxGroupSize adjacent blobs, and
00608   // applies a full search on the classifier results to find the best classified
00609   // segmentation. As a compromise to obtain better recall, 1-1 ambigiguity
00610   // substitutions ARE used.
00611   bool FindSegmentation(const GenericVector<UNICHAR_ID>& target_text,
00612                         WERD_RES* word_res);
00613   // Recursive helper to find a match to the target_text (from text_index
00614   // position) in the choices (from choices_pos position).
00615   // Choices is an array of GenericVectors, of length choices_length, with each
00616   // element representing a starting position in the word, and the
00617   // GenericVector holding classification results for a sequence of consecutive
00618   // blobs, with index 0 being a single blob, index 1 being 2 blobs etc.
00619   void SearchForText(const GenericVector<BLOB_CHOICE_LIST*>* choices,
00620                      int choices_pos, int choices_length,
00621                      const GenericVector<UNICHAR_ID>& target_text,
00622                      int text_index,
00623                      float rating, GenericVector<int>* segmentation,
00624                      float* best_rating, GenericVector<int>* best_segmentation);
00625   // Counts up the labelled words and the blobs within.
00626   // Deletes all unused or emptied words, counting the unused ones.
00627   // Resets W_BOL and W_EOL flags correctly.
00628   // Builds the rebuild_word and rebuilds the box_word.
00629   void TidyUp(PAGE_RES* page_res);
00630   // Logs a bad box by line in the box file and box coords.
00631   void ReportFailedBox(int boxfile_lineno, TBOX box, const char *box_ch,
00632                        const char *err_msg);
00633   // Creates a fake best_choice entry in each WERD_RES with the correct text.
00634   void CorrectClassifyWords(PAGE_RES* page_res);
00635   // Call LearnWord to extract features for labelled blobs within each word.
00636   // Features are written to the given filename.
00637   void ApplyBoxTraining(const STRING& filename, PAGE_RES* page_res);
00638 
00640   // Returns the number of misfit blob tops in this word.
00641   int CountMisfitTops(WERD_RES *word_res);
00642   // Returns a new x-height in pixels (original image coords) that is
00643   // maximally compatible with the result in word_res.
00644   // Returns 0.0f if no x-height is found that is better than the current
00645   // estimate.
00646   float ComputeCompatibleXheight(WERD_RES *word_res);

00887   // Min acceptable orientation margin (difference in scores between top and 2nd

00889   double_VAR_H(min_orientation_margin, 7.0,
00890                "Min acceptable orientation margin");
00891   BOOL_VAR_H(textord_tabfind_show_vlines, false, "Debug line finding");
00892   BOOL_VAR_H(textord_use_cjk_fp_model, FALSE, "Use CJK fixed pitch model");
00893   BOOL_VAR_H(tessedit_init_config_only, false,
00894              "Only initialize with the config file. Useful if the instance is "
00895              "not going to be used for OCR but say only for layout analysis.");
00896   BOOL_VAR_H(textord_equation_detect, false, "Turn on equation detector");
00897 
00899   FILE *init_recog_training(const STRING &fname);
00900   void recog_training_segmented(const STRING &fname,
00901                                 PAGE_RES *page_res,
00902                                 volatile ETEXT_DESC *monitor,
00903                                 FILE *output_file);
00904   void ambigs_classify_and_output(WERD_RES *werd_res,
00905                                   ROW_RES *row_res,
00906                                   BLOCK_RES *block_res,
00907                                   const char *label,
00908                                   FILE *output_file);
00909 
00910   inline CubeRecoContext *GetCubeRecoContext() { return cube_cntxt_; }
00911 
00912  private:
00913   // The filename of a backup config file. If not null, then we currently
00914   // have a temporary debug config file loaded, and backup_config_file_
00915   // will be loaded, and set to null when debug is complete.
00916   const char* backup_config_file_;
00917   // The filename of a config file to read when processing a debug word.
00918   STRING word_config_;
00919   // Image used for input to layout analysis and tesseract recognition.
00920   // May be modified by the ShiroRekhaSplitter to eliminate the top-line.
00921   Pix* pix_binary_;
00922   // Unmodified image used for input to cube. Always valid.
00923   Pix* cube_binary_;
00924   // Grey-level input image if the input was not binary, otherwise NULL.
00925   Pix* pix_grey_;
00926   // Input image resolution after any scaling. The resolution is not well
00927   // transmitted by operations on Pix, so we keep an independent record here.
00928   int source_resolution_;
00929   // The shiro-rekha splitter object which is used to split top-lines in
00930   // Devanagari words to provide a better word and grapheme segmentation.
00931   ShiroRekhaSplitter splitter_;
00932   // Page segmentation/layout
00933   Textord textord_;
00934   // True if the primary language uses right_to_left reading order.
00935   bool right_to_left_;
00936   Pix* scaled_color_;
00937   int scaled_factor_;
00938   FCOORD deskew_;
00939   FCOORD reskew_;
00940   TesseractStats stats_;
00941   // Sub-languages to be tried in addition to this.
00942   GenericVector<Tesseract*> sub_langs_;
00943   // Most recently used Tesseract out of this and sub_langs_. The default
00944   // language for the next word.
00945   Tesseract* most_recently_used_;
00946   // The size of the font table, ie max possible font id + 1.
00947   int font_table_size_;
00948   // Cube objects.
00949   CubeRecoContext* cube_cntxt_;
00950   TesseractCubeCombiner *tess_cube_combiner_;
00951   // Equation detector. Note: this pointer is NOT owned by the class.
00952   EquationDetect* equ_detect_;
00953 };
00954 
00955 }  // namespace tesseract
